--- In nbwrpg@y..., robertdahl <rdahl@t...> wrote:
> Beachcomber looked to the fuel line. Finally some progress, he 
thought
> to himself. "Well, it dosent matter where your from, to any robot 
this
> is fatal." he said, emitting a low power laser from one hand, as he 
held
> the line to graft it into place. The superstructure could wait, but 
this
> fuel pump and engine couldn't. He then went to the engine, grafting
> damaged parts together, mostly doing as little as possible as not to
> wreck anything.


::REDHOT::

    Redhot continued resting, his eyes closed. He silently tolerated 
the Autobot's prodding. The rest seemed to do some good. That and the 
energy he had drunk were helping stabalize his mind. He used the time 
and his growing strength to remember his last trip to Cybertron. He 
remembered his lover and the...pleasurable...momments they shared 
before his departure. He remebered sharing friendly words with his 
brothers, notably Starscream and Skywarp. Redhot sighed, desperately 
homesick. Sometimes he hated dimension travel.
    He looked up at the Autobot as he repaired his 'engine', a 
grateful smile brightening his weary face.
    'Th..thank you." he whispered.

Northlight
Domnijoe Productions

**************************
